rule: Enrichment lives outside canonical question files. No wording/ID/order changes.

entries.prompt: How should responsibility be assigned for leaks or damage associated with indoor installations?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: Unlimited liability = unlimited pricing | Scope: Claims, customer satisfaction, emergency response

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Contractor liable for workmanship only; pre-existing plumbing is utility/customer
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Define criteria, documentation, response time, and claim workflow

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: Will the utility provide service-level or asset-level data to support installation planning?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: No/partial asset data forces survey labor or conservative production rates | Scope: Material kitting, truck load-outs, failed visits, rework, schedule slip

pricingDrivers: No/partial asset data forces survey labor or conservative production rates
scopeImpacts: Material kitting, truck load-outs, failed visits, rework, schedule slip

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume data is partial unless proven otherwise; include survey/add-alternate or contingency
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Require sample extract + data dictionary + accuracy statement; align change control to data defects

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: How should existing service-level or asset-level data be relied upon for installation planning and deployment?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: If contractor must validate everything, price rises (survey + failed installs) | Scope: Disputes over productivity and exceptions if data is informational only

pricingDrivers: If contractor must validate everything, price rises (survey + failed installs)
scopeImpacts: Disputes over productivity and exceptions if data is informational only

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume data requires validation; trigger survey recommendation and explicit exception workflow
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Contract language: who owns data accuracy, what happens when it is wrong, and how exceptions are paid

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: Who is responsible for customer outreach and appointment scheduling for indoor meter installations?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: Who owns scheduling drives staffing, call center cost, failure rate | Scope: Completion curve, cancellations, no-response plateau

pricingDrivers: Who owns scheduling drives staffing, call center cost, failure rate

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume contractor-led scheduling is required for performance; price call center if unknown
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Define roles, outreach plan, and utility support actions

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: Are there any labor compliance or workforce requirements applicable to this project?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: Prevailing wage / Davis-Bacon / PLA / union requirements can swing unit pricing materially | Scope: Crew composition, productivity assumptions, mobilization and admin burden

pricingDrivers: Prevailing wage / Davis-Bacon / PLA / union requirements can swing unit pricing materially
scopeImpacts: Crew composition, productivity assumptions, mobilization and admin burden

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume prevailing wage / compliance unknown; carry contingency and require disclosure pre-award
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Require explicit labor compliance language and funding source disclosure early

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: What is the expected primary method for shutting off water during indoor meter replacement?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: If curb stop/valves are unreliable, installs slow and risk skyrockets | Scope: Crew tooling, escalation needs, failure modes

pricingDrivers: If curb stop/valves are unreliable, installs slow and risk skyrockets
scopeImpacts: Crew tooling, escalation needs, failure modes

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume interior valve preferred with curb stop backup; require curb stop authorization clarity
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Define isolation method, backup plan, and who responds when isolation fails

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: Will the Utility provide a master CIS/service data file?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: No master file = manual build of work orders, high admin cost | Scope: Start-up timeline, integration, quality

pricingDrivers: No master file = manual build of work orders, high admin cost

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume master file exists but may be incomplete; require sample and refresh plan
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Require sample extract, cadence, transfer method, and defect process

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: If RTU/UIR items remain unresolved due to utility-side delays, may the contractor advance to new routes?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: No protection forces repeated revisits and kills production | Scope: Schedule certainty and cashflow

pricingDrivers: No protection forces repeated revisits and kills production

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume contractor must be allowed to advance when blocked by utility delays
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Add progression rule: unresolved RTU/UIR does not block new routes after documentation

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: Will a pre-deployment field survey or audit be required to validate asset data, site conditions, or work scope prior to installation?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: Survey cost vs embedding contingency into unit price | Scope: Schedule sequencing (survey -> kitting -> install) and gating to start

pricingDrivers: Survey cost vs embedding contingency into unit price
scopeImpacts: Schedule sequencing (survey -> kitting -> install) and gating to start

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume limited survey required if data uncertainty exists; propose optional add-alternate
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Define survey scope, deliverables, acceptance, and how survey results adjust quantities

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: If an interior shutoff valve is non-functional, is replacement authorized?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: No authorization creates abandonments and revisits; yes creates material + labor costs | Scope: Customer coordination, utility dispatch needs

pricingDrivers: No authorization creates abandonments and revisits; yes creates material + labor costs

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume not authorized unless defined; include contingency line item if unknown
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Define decision tree: replace under allowance vs utility responsibility

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: If installation is correct but communication fails due to system/material constraints, how is responsibility assigned?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: If contractor eats comm failures, bids get padded | Scope: Warranty disputes and rework

pricingDrivers: If contractor eats comm failures, bids get padded

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume ownership is case-by-case unless clarified; flag as major commercial risk
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Separate install workmanship vs system/material constraints; set responsibility boundaries

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: How should locations outside contractor scope be handled?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: Undefined RTU = contractor absorbs out-of-scope time unless paid | Scope: Exception handling, reconciliation, program closeout

pricingDrivers: Undefined RTU = contractor absorbs out-of-scope time unless paid

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume RTU exists; require formal disposition + commercial treatment
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Define RTU reasons, documentation, and payment rules (attempt fee or unit credit)

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: Will contractor-provided call center and dispatch capability be required for indoor scheduling?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: Call center is a real cost center; pretending otherwise is expensive | Scope: Same-day fills, cancellation recovery

pricingDrivers: Call center is a real cost center; pretending otherwise is expensive

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume call center needed for meaningful indoor volume; include in pricing if undefined
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Define staffing hours, channels, language needs, and dispatch authority

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: Will route-level completion thresholds be required before advancing?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: Hard gating thresholds reduce productivity and increase revisits | Scope: Route closure definition, RTU/UIR backlog, completion plateau risk

pricingDrivers: Hard gating thresholds reduce productivity and increase revisits
scopeImpacts: Route closure definition, RTU/UIR backlog, completion plateau risk

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume gating exists unless explicitly denied; require progression protection language
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Define closure dispositions + allow advance when remaining are RTU/UIR/no-access

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.

entries.prompt: How should locations requiring utility action be handled?

risk.why: Unanswered question materially increases execution uncertainty and commercial exposure.
risk.impact: Pricing: UIR delays create idle time, route churn, remobilization | Scope: Utility responsiveness, backlog management

pricingDrivers: UIR delays create idle time, route churn, remobilization

defaults.ifUnansweredAssumption: Assume UIR occurs; require SLA/response windows or progression protection
defaults.mitigationGuidance: Define utility action SLA and contractor right to advance

clarifications: Clarify this item in RFP/addendum or pre-award Q and A; if unresolved, carry contingency and define change-control triggers.
